address: Xã Kim Hoa, Huyện Hương Sơn, Tỉnh Hà Tĩnh
thought:
**Determining the New Ward for an Old Address**

Okay, so I've got "Xã Kim Hoa, Huyện Hương Sơn, Tỉnh Hà Tĩnh" to work with. First things first, I see "Tỉnh Hà Tĩnh" – that's my province. I'll need to check the province resolutions to make sure there haven't been any changes to its name, but I already know that 60-NQ/TW says Hà Tĩnh stays "Tỉnh Hà Tĩnh".

Next, I need to dive into other resolutions. I know I'm looking for anything related to "Tỉnh Hà Tĩnh" and bingo, I find 1665/NQ-UBTVQH15, which seems promising – it's about administrative changes in Hà Tĩnh. Time to start scanning. I'm focusing on "Xã Kim Hoa".

Line 42 isn't helpful, no mention of it. But wait, Line 48 is exactly what I need! It states that "Xã Hàm Trường" and the original "Xã Kim Hoa" have merged to form a *new* ward also named "**Xã Kim Hoa**". Perfect. That's a direct match. The other lines are for other ward reorganizations but not relevant to this address.

So, the old "Xã Kim Hoa" is now part of the new "Xã Kim Hoa", confirmed. I just need to double-check this with the "New wards" list to be absolutely sure.

And there it is, a perfect match in the "New wards" list: `{"ward_code":"18223","ward_name":"Xã Kim Hoa","province_name":"Tỉnh Hà Tĩnh"}`. High confidence here. We have the resolution supporting the change from the old name to the new same name.

Now, I just need to construct the JSON output and I'm done.

citation.header: 1665/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Hà Tĩnh
citation.line: 48. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của xã Hàm Trường và xã Kim Hoa thành xã mới có tên gọi là **xã Kim Hoa**.
